title.narrative: Provision of Humanitarian Assistance to Drought Affected, Displaced and Vulnerable Somalis

description.narrative: In response to the persistent and increasing humanitarian needs, IOM implements a multi-sector humanitarian response in the areas of Camp Coordination and Camp Management (CCCM), Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM), health, nutrition and, water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) to strengthen and scale up existing life-saving humanitarian assistance. Activities will target large displacement sites in the country that havebeen receiving significant influx since the onset of the 2017 drought. CCCM and DTM activities complement the overall response by providing accurate and up to date data to inform response and coordinate humanitarian partners to facilitate a holistic and practical response inareas of high displacement. CCCM, health and WASH project activities will be provided in a holistic approach to support to communities susceptible to cholera and wherein public health concerns are exacerbated by overcrowded living conditions. The proposed project is inline with three out of the four key strategic objectives outlined in theSomalia Humanitarian Response Plan (HRP) which includes: 1. Provision oflife-saving assistance; 2. Reducing acute malnutrition; and, 3. Reinforcing provision of protection services to affected communities.
